Indirect addressing register 0.description: Indirect addressing register 0, accesses the RAM location pointed to by MP0. Not physically implemented.

MP0.description: Memory pointer register 0, used to provide the address for indirect RAM access via Indirect addressing register 0.

Indirect addressing register 1.description: Indirect addressing register 1, accesses the RAM location pointed to by MP1. Not physically implemented.

MP1.description: Memory pointer register 1, used to provide the address for indirect RAM access via Indirect addressing register 1.

BP.description: Bank pointer register, used to select the current data memory bank (Bank 0 or Bank 1).

ACC.description: Accumulator register, closely related to ALU operations and capable of operating with immediate data.

PCL.description: Program counter lower-order byte register, used for short jumps within a 256-location range.

TBLP.description: Table pointer register, indicates the table location for 'TABRDC' and 'TABRDL' instructions.

TBLH.description: Table higher-order byte register, stores the higher-order byte of data read from a table location.

STATUS.description: Status register containing Carry (C), Auxiliary Carry (AC), Zero (Z), Overflow (OV), Power Down Flag (PDF), and Watchdog Time-out Flag (TO).

INTC0.description: Interrupt control register 0, contains enable/disable bits and request flags for master, external, and Timer/Event Counter 0/1 interrupts.

PAC.description: Port A control register, configures I/O direction, pull-high resistors, and wake-up functions for Port A pins.

PBC.description: Port B control register, configures I/O direction, pull-high resistors, and A/D input selection for Port B pins.

PC.description: Port C input/output data register. (PC5-PC7 available only in 48-pin package).

PCC.description: Port C control register, configures I/O direction and pull-high resistors for Port C pins. (PC5-PC7 available only in 48-pin package).

PDC.description: Port D control register, configures I/O direction and pull-high resistors for Port D pins.

PWM0.description: PWM channel 0 data register, controls the duty cycle of PWM output on PD0.

PWM1.description: PWM channel 1 data register, controls the duty cycle of PWM output on PD1.

PWM2.description: PWM channel 2 data register, controls the duty cycle of PWM output on PD2 (48-pin package only).

PWM3.description: PWM channel 3 data register, controls the duty cycle of PWM output on PD3 (48-pin package only).

INTC1.description: Interrupt control register 1, contains enable/disable bits and request flags for A/D converter and I2C Bus interrupts.

HADR.description: I2C Bus slave address register, stores the device's own 7-bit slave address.

HCR.description: I2C Bus control register, manages I2C communication parameters and operations.

HSR.description: I2C Bus status register, indicates the current status of the I2C Bus operations.

HDR.description: I2C Bus data register, holds data to be transmitted or received over the I2C Bus.

ADRL.description: A/D result lower-order byte register, stores the lower 8 bits of the 10-bit A/D conversion result.

ADRH.description: A/D result higher-order byte register, stores the higher 2 bits of the 10-bit A/D conversion result.

ADCR.description: A/D control register, configures A/D conversion settings, including channel selection and start conversion.

ACSR.description: A/D clock setting register, configures the A/D converter clock source.

PF.description: Port F input/output data register (available only in 48-pin package).

PFC.description: Port F control register, configures I/O direction and pull-high resistors for Port F pins (available only in 48-pin package).
